intro: Kairoa suberosa, commonly known as the kairoa, is a shrub native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. Its leaves are often used in traditional Māori medicine for their purported healing properties. Kairoa suberosa thrives in coastal and forested areas, adapting well to varying soil and light conditions.
